covid_dashboard.tests package¶

Submodules¶

covid_dashboard.tests.test_all module¶

Testing of scheduling and additional functionality

Functions: test_data_schedule_update, test_news_schedule_update, test_cut_article, test_completed_alarms

covid_dashboard.tests.test_all.test_completed_alarms() → None¶

Test: Tests that if no event in update list, completed_alarms returns (None,None)

covid_dashboard.tests.test_all.test_cut_article() → None¶

Test: checks whether the function cut_article takes the first 25 words of a string

covid_dashboard.tests.test_all.test_data_schedule_update() → None¶

Test: schedules a data update. Expected result is that an update is scheduled and displayed in the log.

covid_dashboard.tests.test_all.test_news_schedule_update() → None¶

Test: schedules a news update. Expected result is that an update is scheduled and displayed in the log.

covid_dashboard.tests.test_covid_data_handler module¶

Testing of data handling

Functions: test_parse_csv_data, test_process_covid_csv_data, test_covid_API_request, test_schedule_covid_updates

covid_dashboard.tests.test_covid_data_handler.test_covid_API_request() → None¶

Checks if the data returned by covid_API_request is a dictionary

covid_dashboard.tests.test_covid_data_handler.test_parse_csv_data() → None¶

Checks function parse_csv_data interprets the correct number of lines from set file nation_2021-10-28.csv

covid_dashboard.tests.test_covid_data_handler.test_process_covid_csv_data() → None¶

Checks function test_process_covid_csv_data calculates correct data from set file nation_2021-10-28.csv

covid_dashboard.tests.test_covid_data_handler.test_schedule_covid_updates() → None¶

Runs the schedule_covid_updates with parameters update_interval=10 and update_name=’update test’ to check result

covid_dashboard.tests.test_news_data_handling module¶

covid_dashboard.tests.test_news_data_handling.test_news_API_request() → None¶

Checks if news_API_request returns a value and if it has default values of ‘Covid COVID-19 coronavirus’

covid_dashboard.tests.test_news_data_handling.test_update_news() → None¶

Runs function update_news with paramter ‘test’ to check the result
